content.raw:
Setting the `IGN_PARTITION` on my two running containers to be different did not seem to fix the issue \(I used `IGN_PARTITION=subt$(date +%s%N)` in the Dockerfile\)

As a side note: if ignition is running in the docker container, I can interact with it from the host if I set the `IGN_PARTITION=subt` variable\\

Also: this solves our other mystery of why we got robots even though robot names were not specified on the command line \(see e.g. issue #82\) – they were being launched by somebody else! I can confirm that robots appear in ignition in one docker container when they are spawned in another.
content.html:
Setting the IGN_PARTITION on my two running containers to be different did not seem to fix the issue (I used IGN_PARTITION=subt$(date +%s%N) in the Dockerfile)

As a side note: if ignition is running in the docker container, I can interact with it from the host if I set the IGN_PARTITION=subt variable\

Also: this solves our other mystery of why we got robots even though robot names were not specified on the command line (see e.g. issue #82) – they were being launched by somebody else! I can confirm that robots appear in ignition in one docker container when they are spawned in another.
